title: Apple macOS powerd Uninitialized Memory Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Apple macOS. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the powerd daemon. The issue results from the lack of proper initialization of memory prior to accessing it. An attacker can leverage this in conjunction with other vulnerabilities to escalate privileges and execute code in the context of root.
addtionnal_details: Apple has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211931
timeline:
2020-07-29 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2020-12-04 - Coordinated public release of advisory
